item.title: Vim
item.description:
Vim

[link—standalone]

Switching from using PhpStorm to Vim is a huge step but, I'm willing to give it a go. I have building this website in Vim with the help of google to help me with a few Vim commands. I found few online resources that suggest to replace ESC key for Caps key this way you wouldn't be going all the way to the ESC key to switch modes.

https://faq.i3wm.org/question/1496/change-caps-lock-to-esc-in-i3.1.html

A few things for me to look into

  • Bracket completion for html and php <p></p>.
  • Language completion for html and php.
  • Alias to change to frequent used directories.
  • Learn more Vim commands to help me move around better.

item.title: Tweaking .vimrc
item.description:
Tweaking .vimrc

[link—standalone]

First week on Arch and i3 done, I have added a few settings for Vim to help me out.

  • set nocompatible
  • syntax on
  • set encoding=utf-8
  • set number
  • set relativenumber

item.title: The Start
item.description:
The Start

[link—standalone]

Saturday night, I said goodbye to my Windows. Gone is Adobe, Office and PhpStorm software. My goal is to only use free and open sourced software. Armed with a usb stick with Arch Linux on it. I managed to get through the installation stage and just do a few little changes. I ended up choosing i3 gaps, this is going to be a intresting ride.
